oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Palladium(II)-Catalyzed meta-C-H Olefination: Constructing Multisubstituted Arenes through Homo-Diolefination and Sequential Hetero-Diolefination
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BERA, M
MAJI, A
SAHOO, SK
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: LATE-STAGE DIVERSIFICATION
CATALYZED DIRECT ARYLATION
ELECTRON-DEFICIENT ARENES
U-SHAPED TEMPLATE
BOND ACTIVATION
HECK REACTION
DIRECTING GROUP
CONJUGATED POLYMERS
ROOM-TEMPERATURE
FUNCTIONALIZATION
C-H activation
olefination
palladium
sulfur
synthetic methods
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Divinylbenzene derivatives represent an important class of molecular building blocks in organic chemistry and materials science. Reported herein is the palladium-catalyzed synthesis of divinylbenzenes by meta-C-H olefination of sulfone-based arenes. Successful sequential olefinations in a position-selective manner provided a novel route for the synthesis of hetero-dialkenylated products, which are difficult to access using conventional methods. Additionally, 1,3,5-trialkenylated compounds can be generated upon successful removal of the directing group.
